meanings.definition: To predict or foretell the future based on signs or omens.
meanings.sent1: The old man was auspicating the weather by observing the clouds.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys auspicating the outcome of sports games using her lucky charm.
meanings.sent3: The cat was auspicating the arrival of its owner by staring out the window.
meanings.sent4: The farmer was auspicating a bountiful harvest based on the growth of his crops.
meanings.sent5: The fortune teller was auspicating the fate of her clients with her crystal ball.

meanings.definition: To initiate or inaugurate with ceremonies or rituals.
meanings.sent1: The priest will auspicate the new church with a special blessing ceremony.
meanings.sent2: They are auspicating the opening of the new library with a ribbon-cutting event.
meanings.sent3: The students auspicated the start of the school year with a talent show.
meanings.sent4: The mayor auspicated the city's anniversary celebration with a grand parade.
meanings.sent5: The captain auspicated the ship's maiden voyage with a champagne toast.
